item.title: So, how much do you really understand about (cool) topic X? (also, it's not you who's dumb, find the right source/teacher)
item.dc:creator: Thejasvi Beleyur
item.description:
Working in academia can be quite stressful. Handling the uncertainty of where you'll be in the next few years, and whether you're competent enough at all (impostor syndrome). Even once you assume you've understood something, five minutes later another thing'll come up to show that the mental model you had was actually rather wrong. It can be very frustrating to put in a lot of effort, assume success, and then back to square one.

Read more… (2 min remaining to read)
